Job Position: HR / Comms Assistant&nbsp;(NYSC)

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are seeking to employ&nbsp;a smart, proactive, and creative HR/Comms Assistant (NYSC) to join our growing team. This role is designed for a corps member eager to gain hands-on experience in Human Resources and Corporate Communications.
	You&rsquo;ll work directly with the HR/Comms Executive, supporting day-to-day HR operations, internal communication, and employer branding initiatives &mdash; while learning the ropes of how people, culture, and communication come together to drive business impact.


Key Responsibilities
Human Resources Support:


	Shadow the HR/Comms Executive to learn the end-to-end HR process &mdash; from hiring and onboarding to team engagement and performance support.
	Assist in drafting and posting job descriptions, screening applicants, and coordinating interview schedules.
	Support onboarding activities and maintain employee records.
	Help organize team-building activities, staff events, and internal communication initiatives.
	Assist in maintaining compliance with HR policies and company guidelines.


Communications &amp; Branding:


	Support the development of Wildfire&rsquo;s internal and external communication materials, including newsletters, announcements, and reports.
	Assist in managing the executive&rsquo;s personal brand, helping to craft engaging content and strategies for platforms like LinkedIn.
	Collaborate with the marketing team to ensure consistent messaging and brand tone across all platforms.
	Contribute ideas and content for the company&rsquo;s blog, website, and social media.


Content &amp; Creative Tasks:


	Draft and proofread content such as press releases, blog posts, and newsletters.
	Brainstorm and execute creative communication strategies to improve engagement across Wildfire&rsquo;s internal and external audiences.

	Must be a current NYSC corps member (preferably serving in Lagos).
	Strong written and verbal communication skills.
	A keen interest in HR, communications, or branding.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and Google Workspace (Canva or basic design tools is a plus).
	Excellent communication skills, organizational skills, and attention to detail.

	Competitive pay

        WildFire Business Solutions Limited - We are a full-circle strategy solutions agency passionate about bringing remarkable solutions to life and committed to excellence. At WildFire, we daily leverage on our local advantage to deliver innovative solutions with a global perspective to any industry we are serving.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR / Comms Assistant (NYSC)

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

About the Role

	We are seeking to employ a smart, proactive, and creative HR/Comms Assistant (NYSC) to join our growing team. This role is designed for a corps member eager to gain hands-on experience in Human Resources and Corporate Communications.
	You’ll work directly with the HR/Comms Executive, supporting day-to-day HR operations, internal communication, and employer branding initiatives — while learning the ropes of how people, culture, and communication come together to drive business impact.


Key Responsibilities
Human Resources Support:


	Shadow the HR/Comms Executive to learn the end-to-end HR process — from hiring and onboarding to team engagement and performance support.
	Assist in drafting and posting job descriptions, screening applicants, and coordinating interview schedules.
	Support onboarding activities and maintain employee records.
	Help organize team-building activities, staff events, and internal communication initiatives.
	Assist in maintaining compliance with HR policies and company guidelines.


Communications & Branding:


	Support the development of Wildfire’s internal and external communication materials, including newsletters, announcements, and reports.
	Assist in managing the executive’s personal brand, helping to craft engaging content and strategies for platforms like LinkedIn.
	Collaborate with the marketing team to ensure consistent messaging and brand tone across all platforms.
	Contribute ideas and content for the company’s blog, website, and social media.


Content & Creative Tasks:


	Draft and proofread content such as press releases, blog posts, and newsletters.
	Brainstorm and execute creative communication strategies to improve engagement across Wildfire’s internal and external audiences.


Qualifications 


	Must be a current NYSC corps member (preferably serving in Lagos).
	Strong written and verbal communication skills.
	A keen interest in HR, communications, or branding.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and Google Workspace (Canva or basic design tools is a plus).
	Excellent communication skills, organizational skills, and attention to detail.
	Ability to multitask, take initiative, and work independently under supervision.
	Willingness to learn, grow, and contribute ideas.


What You’ll Gain


	Practical exposure to both HR management and communications strategy.
	A chance to contribute to real projects that shape the Wildfire brand.
	A collaborative work environment where creativity and growth are encouraged.
	Hybrid work flexibility.
	Opportunity to be retained after NYSC.


What We Offer


	Competitive pay
	Commission career
	Growth opportunity


Method of Application

title: Job Openings at Gusto Restaurant Limited
content:
GUSTO is dedicated to providing a world-class dining experience. We value our team as much as we value our guests and offer a supportive and professional work environment with attractive benefits.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Runner

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Duties and Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Delivering food orders from the kitchen to customers’ tables rapidly and accurately
	Picking up food products for orders placed by the service staff and delivering the meal to guests
	Assisting service staff to optimize guests' dining experience.
	Setting of tables using appropriate tableware, utensils, and napkins
	Ensuring food is served in accordance with safety standards
	Checking in with customers and taking additional orders
	Removing used and dirty dishes and utensils from tables.

Application Closing Date: 21st December, 2025.
